basics.name: Benoît Wach
basics.label: Research Engineer CNRS
basics.summary: Research engineer in mechanical and mechatronic design, specialized in additive manufacturing and medical robotics. Expert at CNRS (ICube, Strasbourg) in mechatronic design and integration, additive manufacturing center management, and research support in medical robotics.

work.name: CNRS - ICube Laboratory (UMR 7357), Strasbourg
work.summary: Mechatronic design and management of the additive manufacturing center at the IRIS platform (Imaging, Robotics and Innovation for Health).
highlights: Expertise in medical robotics and additive manufacturing, Management of a mechatronic and electronic prototyping workshop, Support for interdisciplinary research teams, Project management: ANR, SATT, ITI HealthTech

Past work.name: University of Strasbourg - ICube Laboratory (UMR 7357), Strasbourg
Past work.summary: Mechatronic design and management of the additive manufacturing center at the IRIS platform (Imaging, Robotics and Innovation for Health).
highlights: Mechatronic design for multidisciplinary research projects (ANR, FUI BPI, etc.), covering TRL 1 to 7 in the field of medical and surgical robotics.

summary: Volunteer Firefighter – Non-Commissioned Officer (Staff Sergeant) in a Fire and Rescue Station.
highlights: - Emergency medical assistance (first aid & casualty care)
- Various emergency operations (floods, technical rescues, hazardous situations)

awards.title: Nobel Prize in Physics
awards.summary: The Nobel Prizes are five separate prizes that, according to Alfred Nobel's will of 1895, are awarded to 'those who, during the preceding year, have conferred the greatest benefit to humankind.'

projects.name: Quantum Computing
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
